qas.question: What is the coding called that is used with speech?
What is thought of as a basic perceptual coding technique?
What uses a model of the sound's generator?
What is thought of as a basic signal coding technique?
What uses a model of the sound's quantization?
What may be thought of as a basic perceptual spectrum?

plausible_answers.text: the spectrum of the target signal

qas.question: What does reconstruction of an audio signal shape the coder's compressor noise into?
What may be thought of as a generator coding technique?

context: Other types of lossy compressors, such as the <a0_0><a1_0><b3_0><b5_0>linear predictive coding<b5_0/><b3_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/> (LPC) used with speech, are <a2_0><b4_0>source-based coders<b4_0/><a2_0/>. These coders use a model of the sound's generator (such as the human vocal tract with LPC) to whiten the audio signal (i.e., flatten its spectrum) before quantization. <b7_0>LPC<b7_0/> may be thought of as a basic perceptual coding technique: reconstruction of an audio signal using a linear predictor shapes the coder's quantization noise into <b6_0>the spectrum of the target signal<b6_0/>, partially masking it.
